Smallcase was founded in 2015 and the platform launched in 2016. Because of this, a full 10-year performance history for specific Smallcase portfolios does not strictly exist yet. However, we can assess their success over the last ~8-9 years (since inception) which covers the majority of the decade.

The platform's success can be viewed in two parts: the growth of the ecosystem and the financial performance of its most popular portfolios compared to benchmarks like the Nifty 50.

1. Financial Performance (Since Inception vs. Benchmarks)

Many flagship Smallcases have significantly outperformed their benchmarks (like Nifty 50 or Nifty Smallcap 100) since their launch in 2016-2017.[1]

Smallcase NameTheme / StrategyApprox. CAGR (Since Launch)*Benchmark Comparison
Value & MomentumUndervalued stocks with upward price trends~25% - 31%Significantly beat the Nifty 50 (~12-14%) and Multi-Cap funds over the same period.[1]
Electric MobilityEV ecosystem (Battery, Auto, Power)~16.8%Outperformed the broader multicap universe (~15.5%) despite high volatility in the auto sector.[2]
Nifty Infra (Theme)Infrastructure push (Roads, Power, etc.)~22% (Last 3-5Y)The infra theme (tracked by many Smallcases) has delivered nearly 2x the returns of Nifty 50 in the post-COVID cycle (2020-2025).[3][1]
All Weather InvestingStability (Equity + Gold + Debt)~11-13%Designed for stability, not high returns. It has successfully provided lower volatility than the Nifty 50 while beating inflation.[1]

  • Note: Returns fluctuate daily.[4][5][1][6] "Since launch" typically refers to the period from ~2016/2017 to present.

2. Platform "Success" & Adoption

In terms of business success and user adoption over the last decade, Smallcase has changed how retail investors in India invest:

  • Transaction Volume: Over 90,000 Crore has been transacted through the platform.[7][1]

  • User Base: The platform has grown to over 3 million+ users, becoming a primary alternative to mutual funds for younger investors.[1]

  • Ecosystem: It now integrates with all major Indian brokers (Zerodha, Upstox, HDFC, etc.), making it the industry standard for "basket investing."[2][1]

3. Summary of the Decade

  • The "Alpha" Creators: Smallcases focused on Momentum, Small-cap, and Green Energy themes have been the biggest winners of the last decade, often generating returns of 40-60% in strong bull market years (like 2020-2021 and 2023-2024).[1]

  • The Underperformers: Thematic portfolios are cyclical.[1] For example, "Brand Value" (consumption) and "IT" focused Smallcases had periods of underperformance (e.g., 2022) compared to the Nifty, highlighting that unlike mutual funds, Smallcases require you to time your entry/exit into specific themes.[1]

Verdict: If you had invested in the top-performing Smallcases (like Value & Momentum) at their inception ~8 years ago, you would have likely doubled or tripled the returns of a standard Nifty 50 SIP, but with significantly higher volatility.[1]
